intro: Fridericia guilielma, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs.
